titles.title: T'was A Day In Early Springtime

verse.name: v1
verse.lines:
T'was a day in early springtime
By an ancient wayside well
Eliezer paused to rest his camel train
He had found a bride for Isaac
'Ere the evening shadows fell
For his weary journey had not been in vain.
Chorus:
Oh, get ready, evening shadows fall
Don't you hear the Eliezer call
There's going to be a wedding
Our joy will soon begin
In the evening when the camel train comes in!

verse.name: v2
verse.lines:
So he took the fair Rebecca
Decked with jewels rich and rare
Back to Abraham and Isaac far away
Where Rebecca loved her Isaac
And he loved Rebecca fair
Oh, it must have been a happy wedding day.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines:
Now the blessed Holy Spirit
From the Father God above
Has come back to earth to find a worthy bride
For our Isaac over yonder
Has prepared his tents of love
And He wants His fair Rebecca by His side.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines:
We have left our Kinsfolk gladly
We have bade the world good-bye
We are going to a land beyond the sky
Where we'll soon behold our Isaac
In that blessed eternity
What a happy, happy wedding that will be.

verse.name: v5
verse.lines:
Fue un día de primavera, en un pozo en el camino
Eliecer paró su caravana a descansar
Halló novia para Isaac, sombras de la noche caen
Su cansado viaje inútil no lo fue

verse.name: v6
verse.lines:
Oh prepárate sombras de la noche caen
No oyes el llamado de Eliecer?
Va ha haber una boda
Nuestro gozo va a empezar
En la noche al entrar la caravana.

verse.name: v7
verse.lines:
Así se llevó a Rebeca de mil joyas adornada
Con Abraham e Isaac lejos de su hogar
Donde Rebeca amó a Isaac e Isaac a su Rebeca
Esta boda debió haber sido feliz.

verse.name: v8
verse.lines:
Ahora el Santo Espíritu de nuestro Padre Dios
A la tierra una novia vino a buscar
Pues Isaac ha preparado allá sus tiendas de amor
A Rebeca a su lado desea tener.

verse.name: v9
verse.lines:
Dejamos nuestros parientes, dijimos al mundo adiós
vamos a una tierra nueva espiritual
Donde veremos a nuestro Isaac por la bendita eternidad
Que feliz, feliz, feliz, boda será.
